snippet: Carly Fiorina is rising in the polls as she campaigns for president on the strength of her track record as a businesswoman. The trouble is, it’s not a good record, writes Andrew Ross Sorkin, The Times’s DealBook columnist.
abstract: Carly Fiorina is rising in the polls as she campaigns for president on the strength of her track record as a businesswoman. The trouble is, it’s not a good record, writes Andrew Ross Sorkin, The Times’s DealBook columnist.

headline.main: Carly Fiorina Runs on Her Corporate Record, Despite Its Flaws
